meanings.definition: The plural form of turf, referring to a surface layer of earth containing grass and plant roots.
meanings.sent1: The children played on the soft turves in the park.
meanings.sent2: The farmer carefully tended to the turves in his field.
meanings.sent3: The turves in the garden seemed to whisper secrets to each other.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was walking on fragile turves, afraid to disturb the peace.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh turves after the rain was invigorating.

meanings.definition: A piece of turf or sod used for fuel or as a building material.
meanings.sent1: The fireplace crackled as the turves burned brightly.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers stacked the turves to build a sturdy wall.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly tried to cook his dinner on the turves, but quickly gave up.
meanings.sent4: The turves were like bricks, holding together the foundation of the house.
meanings.sent5: She gathered the turves to create a cozy seating area in her backyard.
